App description: How long have these goggles been pressing into my flesh? What began as a small game jam between William Pugh (The Stanley Parable), Dominik Johann (Minit) and Justin Roiland (Rick and Morty) is nowtwo years lateran aberration of warped technology, weird worlds and strange, disturbing creatures. Since its debut, Accounting has tripled in size, mutated into an intricate labyrinth of forbidden virtual realities. With countless more secrets to discover if you have the stomach to brave the dangers of new characters brought to life by a cast of comedic legends (Rich Fulcher, Reggie Watts, and Justin Roiland). DANGERS - If you die in VR, you die in real life. - Do not play after midnight. - Achievements linked to unforgivable acts of human corruption. - A way better soundtrack than a VR game soundtrack has any right to be. - Subtitles and translations for 9 languages. Wow, internationally dangerous! - The vacuum of space. Yeah that dangerous. - And unfortunately: The Cops.

Very weird

I have to admit, I've never seen Rick and Morty. So I got this game based off the preview video being funny. It's VERY raunchy and at times pretty disturbing. I definitely couldn't play it with my wife or son in the room. It's pretty short but if you like the goofy commentary, it stretches the game out.

Technically, it seemed everything worked as it should. I didn't experience any crashes, lag, or glitches. The graphics are perfect for what the game is. The voiceovers are hilarious although at times super creepy.

The only issue I had with the entire game were the subtitles would pretty consistently shift in and out of focus. It was like they would jump from one eye to another. It was so distracting that I had to turn them off and I know I missed a few jokes because of all the arguments that go on through the game.

I gave the game 4 of 5 stars because it definitely have me what I wanted when I bought it. A weird experience that would give me a break from all the serious or puzzle games I have in my library. I'd recommend this for adults or maybe an old teenager.

PEGI 16?

Or ya know.... an edgy basement man boy.

My main gripe though, above all, was the abomination ripoff from Grim Fandango of the seed gun and its weak and completely out of context implementation in this game.

People are weird - game is hilarious

Game review:
I need to start this review by saying most of the low stars (day of release) are because Oculus servers were down and people couldn't download the game. Old rant against them under the game review.

This game is for people with a weird sense of humour. I do not think it is for every one but it was definitely for me!
Some people like to compare it to virtual virtual reality. I can totally see the inspiration. But a lot weirder. There's not much I can say without spoiling you but I promise you I won't.

It took me 1h for my first playthrough and I know I missed some things here and there so I will do it again later today. The visuals are great. The gameplay is nothing innovative but I have to say that the characters react really well to what you do. It adds to the immersion. The sounds are really well done. Sometimes you have objects in your hands that does sounds and it use spacial sound so moving it around will move the sound in the 3D space too!
The price of the game is really good for what you get. Price of a meal at a fast food restaurant but so much better!

Much welcomed to my library of games.

Old rant:
Rating of the game went low because of server issue.
People down voting the game because of that should all be blocked from Oculus reviews because their opinion is Cleary not based on the games themselves but on their incapacity to understand what is happening.

JohnHFreemanJul 11, 2019 at 9:40 AM
Love the game, but this port has issues.

Accounting is a game that way back when it first released I'd always put my friends in when they first try VR. When I saw it coming to the quest, I bought it instantly! I don't regret it as the comedy is still there, but there are some problems that NEED to be fixed in future updates. I'll put them in a list in order I experienced them and also try to be spoiler free.

-The subtitles are horrid. They move in and out and bend while you move your head causing massive eye strain as soon as the game starts. It's like going from looking straight to having to cross your eyes as hard as you can just because you tilted your head. This needs fixed asap.
-In the tutorial it tells you to hold the Menu button to return there. There is no Menu button on the controllers so it's impossible.
-While teleporting you can see outside the borders of the window. It looks bad and I thought it might just be in the first scene, but it looked the same for the rest of the game.
-Scene 2 of the actual game looks bad. I know the Quest isn't super powerful and all, but that scene probably needs revised to match what the Quest can do. It really kills the mood of the scene because it lacks any type of graphic fidelity.
-The scene after using a coin has major framerate issues. I've done it three times, twice after restarting the Quest to make sure it wasn't just a bug, but it still kept happening. It slows to a real chug and I imagine if I didn't have almost 3 years of VR experience I'd probably get really sick.
-In Court, throwing LPDs seems to work 50% of the time. I've tried stopping my arm as soon as I release and while my arm is still moving and both ways lead to it just dropping half the time. I've theorized this may be a hardware issue with the quest as it may lose tracking behind the user and when it can see the controller again it just drops them. However other games do this fine so it might just need some tweaking.

I still love this port, but the issues keep me from suggesting to other users and I can't really throw new people into VR on it because of some of these. It just needs some polish. Looking at the credits it looks like this was ported by tow guys which is impressive! Keep up the good work and looking forward to an update.

YMoosa17Jul 5, 2019 at 2:57 AM
Fun game, technical issues

My first playthrough of this game included several technical mishaps.
Firstly, the subtitles seem to overlap and appear blurry, as if the IPD slider has not been configured correctly. I would recommend disabling these immediately, as I could not find a way to make them appear clearly. It feels like crossing your eyes to look at your nose.
Secondly, there were major graphical issues. The entire screen appeared black, textures refused to load in, at one point there was a large black shape in front of me that followed me around. I also encountered a bug where objects from the previous level would be visible in the current one and the entire screen would flicker. I loaded into a completely black room at one point, left wondering how to progress. Restarting the game did not fix this, but turning my headset to sleep mode and back on seemed to clear everything up.
From then on, I encountered no bugs. The actual game was quite enjoyable, if slightly obtuse. It's extremely short, even including extra levels that require multiple playthroughs to complete. The humour was pleasant and the gameplay was decent.
